questions.question_text:
A marketer would like to improve open rates for weekly email campaigns.
On which area of email design should the marketer focus?

discussion.content:
C is the answer.
Subject lines and sender names help to improve the open rate as they first appear before an email is opened.

Answer - C

Envelope content is the part of an email that's visible in the inbox before it's opened. So it makes sense to focus on that to improve open rates.

Body content on the other hand is the part of an email that's visible after it's opened.
Why not body content - opt B?

comments.content: My assumption is focusing on body content would mean the user has already opened the email

choices.D: Create a Free Form content block.

discussion.content:
d is correct
Free Form gives you complete control to add a combination of text, links, images, and more.
https://trailhead.salesforce.com/content/learn/modules/content-builder-features/explore-content-types?trailmix_creator_id=strailhead&trailmix_slug=prepare-for-your-marketing-cloud-email-specialist-credential

questions.question_text:
The Northern Trail Outfitters' email team is creating a reusable content block for its Deals to Run With campaign. They will cross-promote this campaign in other emails in a single-column content area. This content will have one image, with text below it.
How could the email team create one content area and reuse it across other emails using Content Builder without writing any custom HTML?

discussion.content: B,C are wrong answers .. So by method elimination & the above resource , A,D,E are the right answers

choices.C: They have fewer than 15 data points.
choices.A: They are storing product and store data.

questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters is implementing Marketing Cloud and is unsure whether to use lists or data extensions. Their consultant recommended they use data extensions.
Which three considerations would be taken into account when recommending a data extension-based model over lists? (Choose three.)

A digital marketing team noticed an increase in unsubscribes and would like to implement a mechanism as an alternative to unsubscribing from all sends. The team currently uses data extensions for sending emails.
Which tool should they use?

discussion.content: C would be the best option as we can test client rendering

choices.B: Create a user-initiated email to send to the list of subscribers.
choices.A: Select the ג€Previewג€ tab within the Classic Content tool.
choices.C: Use the Test Send tool to trigger copies of the email.
choices.D: Using the Subscriber Preview tool, cycle through the list of subscribers.

questions.question_text:
A marketer created dynamic content for an upcoming campaign that renders unique content based on subscriber attributes. The marketer would like to preview how each email will render for a given list of subscribers.
How should the marketer proceed?
